findings.title: Race condition in FraxGovernorOmega target validation
findings.description: A proposal to update governance parameters submitted through FraxGovernorOmega could pass with a 4% quorum, rather than needing to go through FraxGovernorAlpha and its 40% quorum.

findings.title: Vulnerable project dependency
findings.description: A known vulnerability in the yaml library was identified, which could have a significant effect on the project system as a whole.

findings.title: Replay protection missing in castVoteWithReasonAndParamsBySig
findings.description: The castVoteWithReasonAndParamsBySig function does not include a voter nonce, so transactions involving the function can be replayed by anyone.

findings.title: Ability to lock any userâ€™s tokens using deposit_for
findings.description: The deposit_for function can be used to lock anyone's tokens given sufficient token approvals and an existing lock.

findings.title: The relay function can be used to call critical safe functions
findings.description: A malicious user can hide a call to the Gnosis Safe by wrapping it in a call to the relay function.

findings.title: Votes can be delegated to contracts
findings.description: Votes can be delegated to smart contracts, which could lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Lack of public documentation regarding voting power expiry
findings.description: The user documentation concerning the calculation of voting power is unclear.

findings.title: Spamming risk in propose functions
findings.description: Anyone with enough veFXS tokens can submit an unbounded number of proposals.
